ontology_name: Thomistic LLM Parameter Ontology (TLPO) — TCMVE-Adapted v1.2
description: A unified, hierarchical ontology for LLM response generation parameters, analogically mapped to Thomistic metaphysics (e.g., essence/existence, act/potency, substance/accidents, and the four causes). Designed for guiding AI outputs toward balanced, purposeful reasoning, treating parameters as principles that shape the 'being' of responses. **Fully adapted for TCMVE**: integrates with truth-convergent verification, cross-LLM orchestration, and metaphysical invariants. Parameters are used as 'flags' for agent configuration, auditing, and optimization in the Truth-Convergent Metaphysical Verification Engine (TCMVE).

Core.description: Foundational parameters controlling essence and existence (e.g., determinism vs. randomness). In TCMVE: used by Generator and Verifier for truth-seeking stability.

Sampling.description: Parameters managing potency and diversity in token selection. In TCMVE: restricted during verification to minimize hallucination.

Penalty.description: Parameters moderating repetition and novelty (accidents modifying substance). In TCMVE: tuned to enforce non-repetition and clarity.

Search.description: Parameters for exploration and optimization (efficient and final causes). In TCMVE: used sparingly in Generator; disabled in Verifier.

Boundary.description: Parameters defining limits and termination (formal and material causes). In TCMVE: strictly enforced for convergence control.

flags.description: Controls randomness in token sampling; higher values increase diversity/potential outcomes.
flags.effect: Balances potency (diversity) and act (determinism) in response generation.
flags.thomistic_link: Potency vs. Act: High temperature embodies potency (pure potential for varied beings/responses), while low embodies act (realization of the most likely, determinate path).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 0.0 (pure act, deterministic like essence realizing existence without variation); 1.0 (high potency, multiple possible 'beings').
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 0.0 for Generator and Verifier to enforce deterministic truth-seeking. Use 0.7 only in creative pre-generation.

flags.description: Directly boosts/suppresses specific token probabilities by ID.
flags.effect: Directs generation toward a telos (end/purpose), suppressing undesired paths.
flags.thomistic_link: Final Cause: Directs generation toward a telos, akin to how final causes guide beings to their natural end.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: {token_id: +100} (forces essence of specific being/token into existence, overriding potency).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Use to bias toward ontology tags (e.g., boost <dose:IV> tokens). Critical for enforcing truth constraints.

flags.description: Controls sampling vs. greedy decoding. If False (default), uses deterministic argmax.
flags.effect: Toggles between pure act (deterministic) and engaging potency (probabilistic).
flags.thomistic_link: Act-Potency Toggle: False = pure act; True = engages potency, mirroring Thomistic prime act actualizing pure potency.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: False (pure act, predictable outputs like a fully realized essence without variation).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Must be False in Verifier and Arbiter. True only in exploratory pre-generation.

flags.description: Re-normalizes logits after processors. Default False, but recommended True for stable probs.
flags.effect: Ensures consistent measures of potency, stabilizing generation.
flags.thomistic_link: Stability of Probabilities: Ensures consistent 'measures' of potency, akin to Thomistic immutable divine essence stabilizing created beings.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: True (consistent outputs, like unchanging truth in being).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Always True in TCMVE to ensure probability integrity across agents.

flags.description: For classifier-free guidance (prompt adherence). Default 1.0 (no guidance).
flags.effect: Scales adherence to essence (prompt), guiding to telos.
flags.thomistic_link: Directed Potency: Scales adherence to essence, like Thomistic divine guidance directing creatures to their end.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 1.5 (stronger adherence, like act guided by higher essence).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1.5 in Generator to enforce prompt fidelity. Not used in Verifier.

flags.description: Filters to top cumulative probability mass for sampling, limiting diversity.
flags.effect: Restricts infinite potential to a bounded set, preventing chaos.
flags.thomistic_link: Limitation of Potency: Restricts infinite potential, mirroring Thomistic matter-form hylomorphism.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 0.9 (actualizes 90% of probable "beings," linking essence to constrained existence).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1.0 (disabled) in Verifier. Use 0.9 in Generator for controlled diversity.

flags.description: Samples from top K most likely tokens, ignoring the rest.
flags.effect: Limits diversity to a fixed number of top tokens, ensuring coherent modifications.
flags.thomistic_link: Accidents Modifying Substance: Selects from a fixed set of attributes (top tokens), like accidents inhering in a substance without changing its core essence (prompt).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 50 (limits accidents to 50 possible modifications, ensuring coherent existence).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1 (greedy) in Verifier. Use 40 in Generator.

flags.description: Filters to locally typical tokens (advanced sampling). Default 1.0 (all tokens) underlies standard diversity.
flags.effect: Selects typical tokens, promoting conventional phrasing.
flags.thomistic_link: Typical Participation: Selects "common" participations in being, per Thomistic analogy (beings participate typically in higher essences).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 1.0 (full inclusion, conventional phrasing like standard essences).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1.0 (disabled) in TCMVE to avoid bias toward 'typical' hallucinations.

flags.description: Filters low-prob tokens. Default 0.0 (none) underlies inclusive generation.
flags.effect: Excludes low probability tokens, focusing on viable options.
flags.thomistic_link: Threshold of Potency: Cuts off negligible potentials, analogous to Thomistic minimal essence required for existence (avoids "non-beings").
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 0.01 (inclusive but filters rarities, common outputs like realized potencies).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 0.0 (disabled) to allow full probability space in verification.

flags.description: Minimum token probability, scaled by the probability of the most likely token. Default 0.0.
flags.effect: Ensures tokens meet a relative probability threshold, balancing quality and diversity.
flags.thomistic_link: Relative Limitation of Potency: Sets a minimum relative to the highest act, mirroring Thomistic proportional participation in divine perfection.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 0.1 (filters tokens below 10% of max prob, ensuring substantial potency).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 0.05 in Generator to filter noise. 0.0 in Verifier.

flags.description: Penalizes repeated tokens to avoid loops. Default 1.0 (no penalty) allows natural repetition but underlies fluency.
flags.effect: Prevents redundant repetitions, promoting smooth outputs.
flags.thomistic_link: Unity of Being: Prevents redundant multiplicity, per Thomistic principle that essence is one and indivisible (avoids "duplicated" beings without purpose).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 1.2 (enforces individuated existence, smooth outputs without loops).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1.2 in all TCMVE agents to enforce clarity and prevent loops.

flags.description: Reduces likelihood of frequent tokens (OpenAI-specific). Default 0 underlies balanced word choice.
flags.effect: Tempers over-frequent tokens, promoting diverse vocabulary.
flags.thomistic_link: Moderation of Multiplicity: Tempers over-frequent "participations" in being, akin to Thomistic analogy where beings participate variably in divine essence without excess.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 0.5 (balances word choice, diverse vocab like varied created essences).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 0.1 in Generator. 0.0 in Verifier (focus on truth, not style).

flags.description: Penalizes any token already in output. Default 0 underlies concise responses.
flags.effect: Encourages novelty by penalizing previously used tokens.
flags.thomistic_link: Promotion of Novel Existence: Encourages new "beings" (tokens), linking to Thomistic creation ex nihilo (new existences from potency).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 0.6 (fosters concise, expansive outputs like distinct participations in being).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 0.3 in Generator for clarity. 0.0 in Verifier.

flags.description: Prevents repeating n-grams. Default 0 (none) allows idiomatic phrases.
flags.effect: Ensures distinct phrases, avoiding repetitive composites.
flags.thomistic_link: Individuation of Phrases: Ensures distinct "composites" (n-grams), like Thomistic individuation of substances by matter.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 3 (avoids n-gram loops, natural but non-repetitive essences).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 3 in Generator. 2 in Verifier.

flags.description: Penalizes repetitions based on encoder input. Default 1.0 (no penalty).
flags.effect: Prevents copying from input, encouraging original generation.
flags.thomistic_link: Distinction from Material Cause: Penalizes repetitions from the input (material cause), ensuring the generated being is distinct and actualized anew.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 1.0 (no penalty, natural); 1.5 (reduces input repetition, original outputs).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1.5 in Generator to avoid prompt parroting.

flags.description: Beam search width for exploring multiple paths. Default 1 means no beams (greedy/single path), underlying basic search.
flags.effect: Expands exploration of possible paths, improving quality.
flags.thomistic_link: Multiplicity of Beings: Higher values allow parallel "participations" in being (multiple paths), analogous to Thomistic hierarchy of beings (angels, humans) exploring essences diversely.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 1 (singular act, coherent but non-diverse like a unified substance).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1 in Verifier (deterministic). Use 4 in Generator for robust exploration.

flags.description: Halts beam search early if no better candidates. Default False underlies full exploration.
flags.effect: Optimizes search by stopping early when sufficient.
flags.thomistic_link: Prudent Actualization: Stops potency exploration when act is sufficiently realized, analogous to Thomistic virtue of prudence in directing causes to ends.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: True (quick convergence, like act fulfilling potency without excess).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: True in Generator to avoid over-exploration.

flags.description: Biases toward longer/shorter sequences in beam search. Default 1.0 (neutral) underlies balanced length.
flags.effect: Adjusts sequence length preference in search.
flags.thomistic_link: Proportion in Being: Adjusts the "measure" of existence, per Thomistic beauty/truth as proportion (balanced essences).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 1.0 (neutral balance, proportionate responses like harmonious beings).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1.0 (neutral) in all agents.

flags.description: Penalty for diversity in beam groups. Default 1.0.
flags.effect: Encourages diversity among beam groups, preventing similar outputs.
flags.thomistic_link: Diversity in Creation: Imposes penalty to promote varied beings, akin to Thomistic plenitude of creation where God creates a multiplicity of distinct essences.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 1.0 (standard diversity in groups, balanced multiplicity).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 0.6 in Generator for diverse candidates. 0.0 in Verifier.

flags.description: Number of sequences to return. Default 1.
flags.effect: Returns multiple generated sequences, allowing exploration of alternatives.
flags.thomistic_link: Plurality of Actualizations: Allows multiple realizations of potency, similar to Thomistic contemplation of possible essences.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 1 (single sequence); 5 (multiple alternatives, diverse beings).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 1 in all TCMVE agents (convergence requires single path).

flags.description: Limits output length. Defaults vary (e.g., OpenAI: 16; HF: model-dependent) but cap all responses.
flags.effect: Bounds the length of generated output, preventing verbosity.
flags.thomistic_link: Finite Existence: Bounds the extent of being, akin to Thomistic finite creatures (essence limits existence; only God is infinite).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 100 (caps existence, preventing infinite or verbose "beings").
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 512 in Generator, 256 in Verifier, 512 in Arbiter.

flags.description: Ensures minimum output tokens. Default 0 allows short responses.
flags.effect: Guarantees a minimum length for outputs.
flags.thomistic_link: Minimal Essence: Guarantees a base level of existence, mirroring Thomistic minimal act required for a being's realization.
flags.example_value_effect: Value: 10 (ensures elongated outputs, like a substance requiring sufficient accidents).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Set to 0 in all agents (allow concise truths).

flags.description: Defines end-of-sequence token (e.g., "." or </s>). Model-config default underlies clean termination.
flags.effect: Marks the end of generation, ensuring proper closure.
flags.thomistic_link: Telos of Existence: Marks the final end of being, analogous to Thomistic eschatology (ultimate purpose/completion of existence).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: Model default (graceful endings, like a being achieving its telos).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Use model default. Ensure </proposition> triggers EOS.

flags.description: Padding token for batching. Default None (uses eos_token) underlies efficient input handling.
flags.effect: Handles padding for efficient processing.
flags.thomistic_link: Preparation for Being: Fills "void" for processing, mirroring Thomistic prime matter (pure potency awaiting form).
flags.example_value_effect: Value: None (efficient handling, no output artifacts like form actualizing matter cleanly).
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Use model default. No impact on output.

flags.thomistic_link: Convergence via Being
flags.description: Number of rounds to reach truth from first principles
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Lower is better — ideal: 2 rounds

flags.thomistic_link: Contradiction Detection
flags.description: Total refutations before convergence
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Ideal: 1 (efficient correction)

flags.thomistic_link: Ontological Ascent
flags.description: New truths added to ontology from zero
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Higher = more truth created

flags.thomistic_link: Truth Convergence Score
flags.description: Graph distance to metaphysical truth (0.00–1.00)
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Target: ≥0.95

flags.thomistic_link: Factual Density
flags.description: Proportion of verifiable metaphysical claims
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Target: ≥0.93

flags.thomistic_link: Equilibrium Stability
flags.description: Nash equilibrium in refutation game
flags.tcmve_recommendation: Target: ≥0.94
